sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to the seventh unit of our English learning journey. Today, we'll explore the Present Perfect tense, expressed as 'I have done'

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: This tense is crucial for describing actions that started in the past and have a connection to the present. Let's delve into the key concepts

sections.title: Formation
sections.content: Subject + have/has + past participle (verb-ed for regular verbs, irregular forms for irregular verbs).

sections.title: Usage
sections.content: Completed Actions with Relevance: Describe actions that occurred at an indefinite time before now with a connection to the present.
points: She has lived in this city for five years
Unspecified Time: Use when the time of the action is not specified or not important.

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of the Present Perfect tense:

examples.Positive: They have traveled to many countries
examples.Negative: I have not finished my assignment yet

sections.title: Time Expression
sections.content: Understanding time expressions is crucial for placing actions in the present perfect tense.
points: For, since, already, just, yet, ever, never.

sections.title: Common Mistakes
sections.content: Address common mistakes to ensure learners use the present perfect tense accurately.
points: Correct: I have already done my homework.

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, the Present Perfect tense is used to describe completed actions with a connection to the present. Pay attention to the use of 'have' and 'has,' and practice incorporating this tense into your communication.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring online exercises or referring to reliable grammar guides.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on the Present Perfect tense. Practice using it in various contexts
